issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing KS 1.7.0, Base UI > Window (Standalone), I opened "traditional modal" window and a "nav bar covered" window. Neither covered the Nav bar. In the case of the modal window, there is a "vibrate" button that is partially obscured by the nav bar.

This does not occur on the Nexus S or the Galaxy tab.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KS 1.7.0 on the Droid
2) Navigate to Base UI > Window (Standalone) 
3) Click either "traditional modal" or "nav bar covered"

Result:
Nav bar not covered

Expected Result:
Nav bar covered

Notes:
Also occurs on 1.6.2 on the droid 1.
fields.summary: Android: KitchenSink Base UI > Window (Standalone) "Traditional modal" and "nav bar covered" windows do not cover nav bar on Droid
fields.environment: Droid 1  (2.2.1), Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201105131803, Titanium SDK version: 1.7.X r3ecace11

comments.body: Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer supported.
